intro: Coffea lebruniana, commonly known as the Lebrun's coffee, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the highlands of Ethiopia, where it thrives in cool, humid climates. The plant produces small, red berries that contain the seeds used for coffee production. It is characterized by its evergreen leaves and compact growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
